p: Ribavirin is a guanine derivative approved for treating respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) and hepatitis C virus (HCV) infections, which also showed positive results in patients with SARS and MERS, but its side effects such as anemia may be severe at high doses [71]. Besides, its potency against SARS-CoV-2 is unknown [72], [73]. One in-silico study revealed the potential ability of Sofosbuvir, Ribavirin, and Remdesevir to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 polymerase [74]. However, another study, mentioned above, ruled it out as an effective therapy for COVID-19. So, it is not yet clear whether it is effective against COVID-19 or not, and more investigation is needed.
